Hit Points.At Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per cleric level after 1st

Proficiencies.Skills: Choose two from History, Insight, Medicine, Persuasion, and Religion

Equipment: (a) a mace or (b) a warhammer (if proficient)
(a) scale mail, (b) leather armor, or (c) chain mail (if proficient)
(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a priest’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack
A shield and a holy symbol

Class Feature Description: At 1st level, you select one of two sacred roles:
- Protector: Grants proficiency in Martial weapons and Heavy armor.
- Thaumaturge: Gain an extra cantrip. Add your Wisdom modifier to Intelligence (Arcana or Religion) checks.
You can cast cleric spells.

At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the cleric spell list. You learn additional cleric cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Cleric table.

The Cleric table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your cleric spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of cleric spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the cleric spell list. When you do so, choose a number of cleric spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your cleric level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a cleric spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
You can cast a cleric spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.
You can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your cleric spells.

You gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Turn Undead and an effect determined by your Divine Domain. Some domains grant you additional effects as you advance in levels, as noted in the domain description. When you use your Channel Divinity, you choose which effect to create. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Channel Divinity again.
As an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to heal a creature within 30 feet of you. The creature regains hit points equal to 1d8 + your cleric level.

At 3rd level, you choose a divine domain that shapes the nature of your divinity. Choose the Life, Light, Trickery, or War domain, each detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 8th, and 17th levels.
- Life Domain: Aid has been added to your Domain spells.
- Light Domain: See Invisibility has been added to your Domain spells.
- Trickery Domain: New abilities are added to your Invoke Duplicity double.

- War Domain: Your Channel Divinity can be used to cast Shield of Faith or Spiritual Weapon without using a spell slot or requiring Concentration. Previous level 1 and 2 subclass abilities are accessed at level 3.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Replaces Destroy Undead, instead deals Radiant damage to every Undead, regardless of CR, that fails their saving throw against your Turn Undead.
At 6th level, the effects of your Channel Divinity improve. You can use your Channel Divinity to grant a creature within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to 2d8 + your cleric level.
Select one option:
- Divine Strike: Deal an additional 1d8 Radiant or Necrotic damage when you hit a creature with an attack roll.
- Potent Spellcasting: Add your Wisdom modifier to damage dealt with a Cleric cantrip.
At 8th level, you gain an additional feature granted by your Divine Domain. Specific features depend on the chosen domain.
At 9th level, you gain an additional feature granted by your Divine Domain. Specific features depend on the chosen domain.
As a Magic action, choose any Cleric spell of level 5 or lower that doesn’t require a reaction. You can cast it without spending components or a spell slot. Restores after Long Rest.
At 11th level, when you use Divine Intervention, you can call upon a celestial being to assist you. The celestial grants you and your allies within 30 feet advantage on saving throws for 1 minute.
At 12th level, you gain an additional feature granted by your Divine Domain. Specific features depend on the chosen domain.
Starting at 13th level, your healing spells are more effective. When you restore hit points with a cleric spell, you can add an additional 2d8 hit points to the restored amount.
- Divine Strikes: Damage increases to 2d8.
- Potent Spellcasting: When you deal damage with a Cleric cantrip, you can grant yourself or another Temporary Hit Points.

At 15th level, you can use your Channel Divinity to create an aura that lasts for 1 minute. You and your allies within 10 feet of you have advantage on saving throws and are resistant to all damage types except Psychic.
At 16th level, you gain an additional feature granted by your Divine Domain. Specific features depend on the chosen domain.
At 17th level, you gain an additional feature granted by your Divine Domain. Specific features depend on the chosen domain.
You can cast Wish when selecting a spell for Divine Intervention. After using this feature in this way, you cannot use Divine Intervention again for 2d4 days.
Choose one Epic Boon feat or another qualifying feat of your choice.
You can cast Wish when selecting a spell for Divine Intervention. After using this feature in this way, you cannot use Divine Intervention again for 2d4 days.
